result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad J. Bundick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad J. Bundick

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 3:46 p.m.
Clerk: Nicole.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry. Defendant appears in person with Atty Peter Prusinski.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to;
Amend Count 1 Disorderly Conduct/DA to delete DA enhancer.
COURT grants.

PLEA: 
Count 1 Disorderly Conduct>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: $100.00 fine plus CC. DNA Sample/Surcharge. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan.


Adjourned: 3:53 p.m.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Calendar call on September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:32 am 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Prusinski. 
Parties have reached an agreement. 
COURT removes jury trial set for 9/29/2022. 
CC set for 9/21/2022 at 1:00 pm to set plea hearing. 
Adj: 8:33 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:03 am 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Prusinski. 
Parties do not have an agreement at this time and requests dates remain on as set. 
Atty Prusinski notes he is fairly new to case. 
COURT leaves dates on calendar as set. 
Adj: 10:04 am
